reviewText: Whilst an enjoyable game, as always, I felt that this Midnight Mystery was lacking something.  I just don't know what.  The other games in the series (same game play time) felt more engaging and engrossing, but this one just lacked some ompf.  Game play changed slightly from the earlier games, with voice overs (I had to switch these off), and there seemed to be less hidden object puzzles and the problem solving games didn't seem as challenging.  This game certainly felt more linear than the other games in the series.\n\nI'd recommend it, but only when it's on sale due to the lack of overall engagement and challenge.

reviewText: The game is to up to the usual standard as set by the other games in the series.\nAn interesting story about Jesse James, but I liked Hary Houdini's and Mark Twain's better.\nThough it does feel the game is shorter in play and doesn't have the extra mini games like find the bones or shackles as in the perious games, it is still and interesting game say 4/5.

reviewText: I was so excited when I discovered this game, since I really enjoyed the last 4 Midnight Mysteries games I was anticipating a good game just like the ones before. Unfortunatly, from the opening scenes to the main menu into the gameplay all it did was lag. lag, lag, lag. the opening scene which should only take a few seconds to get through, took 5 minutes. I tired skipping through thinking maybe just the opening scenes were the problem but I was wrong.\n\nMy excitement to play this game turned to disappointment when I couldn't get it to run without lagging. Hopefully Steam will let me get a refund.
